feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Integration Suite
feed.subtitle: SAP Integration Suite Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP ALM
entry.content:
Hi Team,

1) Here i"m integrating with SAPALM to Fresh service.

WE I"m getting below error in Mapping Rules, Do we have some standard mapping for Fresh service.


Error Details ::

422 Unprocessable Entity on POST request for "https://x-rn-srv/message": "{"errorDetails":{"code":"422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY","message":"Configuration error occurred: Bad Request","target":"/message","details":[]}}".


2) Here i"m integrating with SAP ALM to BTP IS.

we i"m facing with connection issue, partner is not assigned to SAPALM service. I tried to configure the service from SAPALM partner is not visible.

Need to setup the connection between SAPALM and BTP IS..

details ::

Log on to SAP BTP Cockpit and navigate to the sub-account for your SAP Build Process Automation 

  1. Go to Connectivity > Destinations
  2. Click on "New Destination"
  3. Create a new destination using the "Blank Template" view
    1. Name: Enter a name for the destination as sap_process_automation_cloud_alm
    2. Type: HTTP
    3. URL: SAP Cloud ALM service key parameter "Endpoints" > "Api" without api (make sure to keep the / at the end)
    4. Authentication: Select 'OAuth2ClientCredentials'
    5. Client ID: SAP Cloud ALM service key parameter "clientid"
    6. Client Secret: SAP Cloud ALM service key parameter "clientsecret"
    7. Token Service URL: SAP Cloud ALM service key parameter "uaa" > "url" + /oauth/token


Required connection setup URL's to specify..

entry.title: Simulation vs Runtime Discrepancy in B2B MAG-
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I'm working on a B2B integration scenario using SAP Integration Suite with Integration Advisor, mapping IDoc DELVRY05 to EDI X12 856. The mapping is fully MAG-compliant, and I’m using XSLT logic to calculate and generate the DTM*017 segment.

Problem,

When I simulate the message in Integration Advisor, the DTM*017 segment is generated correctly.

However, when the same message is processed in a real B2B runtime scenario, the segment is not generated at all — even though the payload is identical in both cases.

entry.title: SAP API PROXY principal propagation error 403
entry.content:
Greetings SAP community,

I have been trying to expose an ODATA service on our on-premsis ECC system through Integration Suite's API Proxy.

I configured all the nesscary steps between BTP and SCC, SCC and the back-end system so that the identity is forwarded to SCC and then to the back-end system by X.509.

I have confirmed that Principal Propagation works as i use it in a Destination Configuration with SAP Graph and it forwards the identity correctly, requests are executed sucessfully.

However when i try to send a request through API Proxy, i recieve an error 403. API Management isnt exactly clear on how the request should be sent to the proxy, whether it should contain a specific header or a token. I have tried to send the JWT recieved from the OAUTH server for an Integration Flow client in the Authorization Header, still getting the same 403 error.

The API provider created for the proxy uses Authentication type "Principal Propagation".

I would appreciate help in this matter.

entry.title: Integration Suite RFC Call with table-data_element as import parameter
entry.content:
I have a problem with a rfc call from integration suite to ERP System. The rfc function has as import parameter a table type and inside it a data element with string 4. Looks like this:

The imported wsdl part looks like this:

System generated automatically the "item" element that we fill with a string in mapping.

If we send the data to erp the intern table has the correct amount of rows but without any values inside:

Do you have any ideas? For me it looks like a bug in integration suite or a restriction in rfc adapter.

entry.title: CPI and Azure storage adapter - huge file size issue - file not read completely from the blob
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a simple flow to get the json file from the storage container and then send it to HTTPS
We have worked with files as big as 87 MB and there was never any issue
However, it is failing with a larger file of 105 MB and it seems that even in the download section in trace, the file is not downloaded fully which means that the iflow did not pick up the full file
I downloaded the message payload but the file is incomplete and what i need to resolve why the message payload is incomplete in the iflow and how can the complete file be processed
When this incomplete message hits the HTTPS which is then received by the REST which is expecting a fully formed JSON, it fails
The iflow is just passing the data payload to target as the target is expecting full and valid json payload, it raises the exception
So i need to be able to find why the payload from the blob is not coming through in full

The flow is really simple -

Connect to the Blob container
Read the JSON data file (this file will be the ONLY file always and is overwritten by the new file on a daily basis with the same name)
Send the data file records to PI REST Sender adapter and get it processed by SAP inbound proxy

The List Blob operation is via the Receiver Azure Storage Adapter with message protocol as BLOB Storage
So how to confirm that the file is not read fully or is incomplete?
Azure Storage adapter is standard
The actual GET to access the file in the blob after get Blob is HTTP as per the examples in the few blogs that i could find
Is there another way to read the data file in the blob container via Azure Storage adapter as i have not seen any operation for actually getting the file data?

So is there a standard way to send JSON data to PI from CPI/Azure Blob?
Can you please advise (maybe some blogs and links that i can check)?

I have also checked the option of doing a local process call but not sure what condition to use to do the loop or terminate.

I even tried looking at the blog where the file is downloaded by the groovy script/using azure storage jar file but i am getting some error by using the same connection that i am using in the iflow to successfully connect to the azure blob

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/get-file-from-azureblob-using-cpi-using-azure-storage-jar/ba-p/13503570

Any advise is also appreciated 

Regards,

Archana

entry.title: SAP PO 7.5 to SAP CPI Neo Tenant Migration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a client based out of UAE for which there is no SAP CPI CF data center available so they are on SAP CPI Neo[Already checked with SAP, cannot be moved to CF].

Now, we are planning to do SAP PO to SAP CPI Neo tenant migration. Have few questions, request you to please guide if someone has done migration using Neo tenant.

1) Is the Migration Assessment tool available for SAP CPI Neo Tenant to link SAP PO system and get the dashboard for Assessment?

2) Is it possible to Migrate through the tool in the neo tenant.

3) Any difficulties to be considered while migration to Neo tenant from SAP PO?

Thanks,

Nidhi Srivastava

entry.title: Clarification on Migration Tool Support for SAP PI 7.31 Dual Stack (SP28)
entry.content:
According to the SAP migration guide, it is stated that interface migration is supported starting from SAP PI 7.31 SP28. However, the documentation does not clearly specify whether this applies to Dual Stack systems or only to Java-only (Single Stack) installations.

We are currently running SAP PI 7.31 Dual Stack on SP28, and would like to understand:

  • Is the SAP Integration Suite Migration Tool supported for Dual Stack systems on this version?

  • If so, could someone please point to any official documentation, SAP Notes, or blogs that confirm this?

  • Any additional guidance or experience around this scenario would also be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Range based Select operation on Datastore using any header or groovy script
entry.content:
Here's my scenario:

  • The Datastore contains 100+ entries.
  • The iflow receives a query parameter start_index from the HTTPS request.
  • Based on this, the iflow should return entries from start_index to start_index + offset, where offset is a configurable property (e.g., 10).

Is there any standard SAP header or a groovy script which can be leveraged to achieve this kind of paginated Select operation on the Datastore?

entry.title: IDoc to SAP CPI issue - Maximum Number of Child Elements limit (50000) exception
entry.content:
Dear Support Team,

 

as per note https://me.sap.com/notes/2703934, we are submitting this case to request the tuning to solve the issue we are getting in SAP Integration Suite during the IDoc transmission (huge number of segments) from SAP ECC. Which is the maximum value you can set? Since we are not totally aware about the max number of segments that can characterize our IDoc transmission, we have to be quite confident that the new tuning can address this issue in a quite stable manner.

entry.title: AS2 Credentials Strategy for Migrating PO Interfaces to SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hello,

We are preparing to migrate numerous PO interfaces to SAP Integration Suite and would appreciate your guidance on the optimal credentials’ strategy and connections architecture. Following recommendations from SAP Note 3251492, we would need dedicated S‑Users per connection partner, each assigned appropriate Cloud Integration access roles.

AS2 connectivity will be handled using individual S‑Users, each mapped to a specific trading partner.

Since we are consolidating dozens of interfaces in a phased migration, we look forward to your recommendations on:

  • Configuration tips or limitations in IAS/Integration Suite regarding inbound AS2 authentication policy scope.
  • Secure credentials and interface isolation, while minimizing disruption for partners
  • S-users maintainability over time (credential rotation, onboarding/offboarding)

Thank you for your guidance and support,

That will be a great help.

entry.title: we are seeing error com.sap.it.rt.adapter.http.api.exception.HttpResponseException: An internal serv
entry.content:
We have configured an API connection (JSON), and the connection works with a small JSON payload (three lines). However, when sending a 100 KB payload, we receive a "Bad Request" error, and our partner does not see any payload on their end for the 100 KB request.

Error:

com.sap.it.rt.adapter.http.api.exception.HttpResponseException: An internal server error occured: Remotely closed. The MPL ID for the failed message is

Could you please provide your input on this issue?

Thanks,

Thiru

entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are getting the connectivity error between iflow (HTTP receiver adapter) and IBM MQ in SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration).. It was working fine until yesterday..

Error code HTTP response body:

javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target..

Ramu.

entry.title: Creation of User Roles in Integration Suite with API
entry.content:
Hello,
I would like to create Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) User Roles via API, but there is no documented API. In API Business Hub I can find APIs for many objects, but not for User Roles (https://api.sap.com/api/SecurityContent/resource).

In the UI I can create user roles via http://xxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com/shell/monitoring/UserRoles, which uses the endpoint https://xxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com/rest/api/v1/tenants/roles/customroles

Unfortunately, this endpoint uses a cookie to authenticate. Any idea how I could create a User Roles using an API?

Thanks,
Maximilian

entry.title: Odata V4 Adapter in SAP CPI to BTP ABAP is Posting the data but throwing an error in IFlow
entry.content:
I am trying to post data from SAP CPI to BTP ABAP table using POST in Odata V4 Adapter in the integration suite. 

I am able to save the data but the Iflow is not getting completed. Instead it throws an error 

com.sap.it.rt.adapter.http.api.exception.HttpResponseException: An internal server error occured: while trying to invoke the method com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode.asText() of a null object returned from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode.get(java.lang.String).

entry.title: Getting Started with SAP Open Connectors
entry.content:
Introduction to SAP Open Connectors

In today’s fast-paced digital landscape, seamless integration across various systems and applications is crucial for business success. SAP Open Connectors, a key capability within the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), is designed to simplify and accelerate this process.

SAP Open Connectors offers a unified API integration layer that streamlines connectivity to over 160 third-party cloud applications, including popular platforms like Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, Google services, and more.

Instead of building and maintaining individual connectors for each application, Open Connectors provides prebuilt connectors with standardized APIs, helping developers avoid the complexity of dealing with diverse authentication methods, pagination formats, error handling, and data models.

Assign Roles in BTP

  • OpenConnectorsAdmin
  • OpenConnectorsUser
  • OpenConnectorsDeveloper

Prerequisites:

  • SAP BTP account (Open Connectors supports trial accounts)

Demonstrate on how to connect Gmail API Connector

Firstly, Add the capabilities for Open Connectors on the Integration Suite. After that, we should assign the role related to Open Connectors.

Step 1: Integration suite Home page >> Capabilities >> Manage Capabilities. Click on “Manage Capabilities”.

Step 2: Click on “Add Capabilities”

Step 3: Click on check box i.e., Extend Non-Sap Connectivity

Step 4: After the above step, you will see the below mentioned in Home Page. Click on “Create Connectors”. After this step, you will be navigate to Open Connectors Home Page.

Open Connectors Configuration

Now, we will be working on Gmail Connector. After navigating to Open Connectors Home Page. You will be able to see the below page. Just, Search for the Gmail in search box.  

Connectors >> Gmail >> My Resources (place the cursor in Gmail connector, then only you can see the Resources) >> Authenticate Instance.

I am creating a new instance with the name of “DemoGmail”.

After this step, you will be redirected to a different page or click this url 

  • https://console.cloud.google.com/

Get Gmail OAuth Credentials 

  • Create a new project or use existing
  • Click on "Select a project".

Give Project Name as Your wish. e.g. My Project - 1 >> Click on "Create". In the search bar, type Gmail API >> Click on Gmail API >> Click Enable.

After enabling your API, you will be redirect to another page.

At this Step:

  • Navigate to Credentials
  • Click on Create Credential
  • Select OAuth client ID

 

  • Click on "Configure consent screen".

  • Click on "Get Started" which is highlighted in blue color.

Give all the details

  • App name: Test
  • User support email: "Give your mail id e.g. xxxx@gmail.com"
  • Choose "External"
  • Contact Information: Give your mail id
  • Click "Agree" checkbox >> Continue >> Create

When you have this page, click on "Create OAuth client".

Fill the details as mentioned in below Image.

Skip "Authorized JavaScript origins"

In "Authorized redirect URIs", Click "Add URI" >> give the urI as mentioned in below image >> Click on "Create". 

Download your credentials by clicking on Download JSON or else you can copy & paste in your notepad. Click on OK.

Go to Hamburger button which is located on Top Left side. You can see API & Services as shown in below image. click on it.

API & Services >> Credentials >> Audience >> Add Users (add your mail id) >> click on "Save".

 Data Access >> Add or remove scopes >> add below scopes >> add to table >> click on update.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.send

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify

Navigate to your open connectors, give your client credentials, create instance.

You will see the below page with success popup.

Click on Test in the API docs

GET: Retrieves data or resources from the server (ex: fetch mail messages). Follow the below images highlighted with red rectangle. 

When you're complete your execution, if no errors you will get 200 message.

entry.title: Real-Time Sales Data Integration with Emarsys Predict Using SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
This blog explores how SAP Integration Suite can be used to send real-time sales data from a commerce system to Emarsys Predict Data Source, enabling Smart Insights to function seamlessly. We'll walk through the integration flow, highlight key and payload structures.

Business Scenario

Let’s consider a retail brand, which wants to send real-time online sales data to Emarsys for Smart Insights. The goal is to capture customer purchase behavior immediately after a transaction and feed it into Emarsys Predict.

Architecture Overview

The integration flow involves:

  1. Source System: Commerce platform generating sales orders.
  2. SAP Integration Suite: Middleware to transform and route data.
  3. Emarsys Predict API: Destination for real-time transactional data.

Integration Flow:

In our integration flow (iFlow), we implemented a real-time sales data pipeline to Emarsys Predict using SAP Integration Suite. Here's a high-level overview of the steps involved, which can be customized based on specific business requirements:

  1. JSON to XML Conversion:
    We began by adding a JSON to XML Converter, setting the root element as "salesOrder" to structure the incoming data appropriately.

  2. Message Mapping:
    A Message Mapping step was introduced where we:

    • Uploaded the input.XSD (representing the incoming XML structure).
    • Uploaded the output.XSD (representing the desired XML format for Emarsys).
    • Applied necessary node functions and custom functions to transform the data.
    • Mapped key fields such as Email and Order ID, using "one as many" logic to loop through order items.

  3. XML to CSV Conversion:
    The transformed XML was then passed through an XML to CSV Converter.

  4. Content Modifier & API Call:
    We used a Content Modifier to add the required CSV headers, followed by a Request-Reply step to send the final payload to the Emarsys Sales API.

    Request Reply - HTTP Adapter Configuration:

Emarsys Sales API Details: Uploading your sales data 

 Sample Input Payload:

{
    "user": "RetailStore",
    "id": "403509910",
    "transType": "SALES_ORDER",
    "transDate": "20230524",
    "transTime": "12:41:56+00:00",
    "marketingArea": "STORE",
    "storeId": "store_gb",
    "totalSalesAmount": 208.0,
    "salesCurrency": "GBP",
    "customerId": "uk.user3@gmail.com",
    "discountPercent": 0.0,
    "discountAmount": 0.0,
    "totalDiscounts": 0.0,
    "promotionDiscounts": 0.0,
    "communicationMedium": "Online",
    "deliveryCost": 0.0,
    "deliveryType": "",
    "deliveryPostalCode": "",
    "deliveryCity": "",
    "deliveryCountry": "",
    "items": [
        {
            "productId": "PROD001",
            "totalPrice": 160.00,
            "unitPrice": 20.0,
            "quantity": 8,
            "discountLineAmount": 0.0,
            "discountLinePercent": 0.0,
            "promotionName": "SAMPLECODE-100-200-300-400-500",
            "promotionCode": "SAMPLECODE-100-200-300-400-500",
            "salesAmount": 160.00
        },
        {
            "productId": "PROD001",
            "totalPrice": 0.00,
            "unitPrice": 0.0,
            "quantity": 1,
            "discountLineAmount": 0.0,
            "discountLinePercent": 0.0,
            "promotionName": "SAMPLECODE-100-200-300-400-500",
            "promotionCode": "SAMPLECODE-100-200-300-400-500",
            "salesAmount": 0.00
        }
    ]
}

This setup ensures seamless and real-time data flow from your source system to Emarsys Predict. The iFlow can be easily modified to accommodate different data structures or business logic as needed.

entry.title: Upsert Attachments From RCM to EC through SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
I’m currently working on an integration scenario where I need to post candidate attachments (like resumes) from SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting (RCM) to Employee Central (EC) using SAP Integration Suite (CPI)

I'm Getting File Content Data as Base64 Encoded and
some records has only resume and some other has resume and attachments (png, images)
data formats: pdf, txt, doc, docx, png

Sample xml record which was docx file.

can anyone please guide the process on how to upsert attachments.
